ygData.subject: RE: negativity
ygData.msgSnippet: Seriously though, it stands to reason that the people who are most in tune (no pun intended) with digging through the game mechanics are also the ones who will
ygData.messageBody:
Seriously though, it stands to reason that the people who are most in tune
(no pun intended) with digging through the game mechanics are also the ones
who will inevitably experience the most aggravation as the 'truth' is
revealed. Not the black helicopter truth but the QA tested truth. This
kind of dedication takes time and energy, most often it doesn't feel
reciprocated.

I think I can safely say that we like this game more than Verant does at
this point. I think EQ is like Verant's teen-ager now. It was cute and
cuddly when it was a baby but now it is difficult, distant, frequently
disrespectful, but still has to be fed it and had a roof put over its head.
;-P

I respect Harmonic and his positive input to this list far outweighs our own
inability to accept the occasional frustration that goes along with it.

I would not be able to play my bard to the degree that I am able today
without the input from this list because quite simply I do not have the
desire to QA it, I just want to play. Nearly everything I know about the
bard and its tricks that I use from day to day came from this list and this
list alone.

When one is passionate about something, well, one is passionate about it.

Faras



> -----Original Message-----
> From: Ryan Honeyman [mailto:honeyman@...]
> Sent: Thursday, February 03, 2000 4:05 PM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] negativity
>
>
> From: Ryan Honeyman <honeyman@...>
>
> > Funny, it actually makes me feel like I want to leave work
> right now and go
> > home and play, like some kind of reverse psychology.
> >
> > I think I am experiencing an negative reality inversion.
>
> Shhh, I'm secretly employeed by Verant and using all these proven
> techniques to make you all shell out more money and keep playing
> the game ;-)
>
> /tell Aradune how much money do I get again for doing this?
>
> Harmonic.
